intro: Raffenaldia primuloides subsp. riphaensis, commonly known as the riphaen alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are basal, forming a rosette, and the stems are usually unbranched. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
